Class GameControlerSquare

java.lang.Object
graphics.GameControlerSquare
public final class GameControlerSquare extends Object
GameControlerSquare contains every functions needed to interact with the player in the graphic square version of Cascadia

    • askOverPpulation

      public static int askOverPpulation(com.github.forax.zen.ApplicationContext context, int widthScreenInfo, int heightScreenInfo)
      askOverPpulation takes player input and makes sure that it is correct, if not, it will wait for the next event until a correct event is given
      Parameters:
      context - ApplicationContext representing the application being run
      widthScreenInfo - int representing the width of the screen
      heightScreenInfo - int representing the height of the screen
      Returns:
      int representing the player choice

    • askPositionWildlifeToken

      public static Coordinate askPositionWildlifeToken(com.github.forax.zen.ApplicationContext context, int widthScreenInfo, int heightScreenInfo, int marge, Map<Coordinate,TileSquare> playerBoard, Set<Coordinate> movesWildlife)
      askPositionWildlifeToken takes player input and makes sure that it is correct, if not, it will wait for the next event until a correct event is given
      Parameters:
      context - ApplicationContext representing the application being run
      widthScreenInfo - int representing the width of the screen
      heightScreenInfo - int representing the height of the screen
      marge - int representing the size of the rectangle for a tile
      playerBoard - Map representing the board of a player
      movesWildlife - is a Set representing all the player moves
      Returns:
      TileSquare representing the player choice

    • askCoordinateTile

      public static Coordinate askCoordinateTile(com.github.forax.zen.ApplicationContext context, int widthScreenInfo, int heightScreenInfo, int marge, Set<Coordinate> movesTile)
      askCoordinateTile takes player input and makes sure that it is correct, if not, it will wait for the next event until a correct event is given
      Parameters:
      context - ApplicationContext representing the application being run
      widthScreenInfo - int representing the width of the screen
      heightScreenInfo - int representing the height of the screen
      marge - int representing the size of the rectangle for a tile
      movesTile - Set representing the available tile moves
      Returns:
      Coordinate representing the player choice
